intro: Nolana patachensis, commonly known as the Chilean starflower, is a flowering plant native to Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has hairy leaves and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Nolana patachensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
